knimeNode.name: Shape Manager
knimeNode.shortDescription: Assigns shapes to one selected nominal column.

intro.p: Assigns (different) shapes for each attribute value of one nominal column, i.e. for each possible value. Supporting views then render datapoints with the shape associated with the corresponding attribute value. If there is for example a dataset with two different classes ("class1" and "class2"), "class1" may have a circle and "class2" a triangle assigned. When looking at the dataset the values can easily be distinguished through their shape.

In the dialog the nominal column with the possible values may be selected. The possible values appear in the left column and the shape can be set in the right column of the table by clicking on it and selecting the desired shape.

fullDescription.option: Select the nominal column whose possible values should be associated with shapes.

The possible values of the selected nominal column are listed in the left column. In order to associate a shape with that value click on the shape displayed in the right column and select the desired shape.

ports.dataIn: Table to which shape settings should be applied to
ports.dataOut: Same table with shape information applied to one column
ports.modelOut: Shapes applied to the input table
